meanings.definition: Jumbled or confused speech or writing
meanings.sent1: Her garbles made it hard to understand what she was trying to say.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's garbles in class confused the students.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's garbles during the show had the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: The garbles of the toddler's story were like a puzzle to unravel.
meanings.sent5: The garbles of the old radio broadcast echoed through the room.

meanings.definition: To distort or confuse a message or information
meanings.sent1: He garbles the facts to make his argument seem stronger.
meanings.sent2: The static on the phone line garbles the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The spy tried to garbles the secret code to protect it.
meanings.sent4: The rumor mill garbles the truth until it's unrecognizable.
meanings.sent5: The fog garbles the view of the city skyline.

meanings.definition: To mix up or scramble words or sounds
meanings.sent1: She accidentally garbles her words when she's nervous.
meanings.sent2: The faulty microphone garbles the singer's voice during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The chef garbles the recipe instructions and ends up with a strange dish.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind garbles the sound of the music playing in the park.
meanings.sent5: The tired news anchor garbles the breaking news report on live TV.
